Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2011 08:09PM katehudson25 wrote: Hi Sheila, There really isn't any treatment for this condition. It clears up on its own after the cause is take care of. Among other things it is caused by stress, medications, extreme dieting and surgery. If you have stopped your medication it should clear up in about 3 months. It will take at least 6 to 9 months for you to notice that your hair is thicker. As I mentioned in an earlier post nutrition is very important and it is helpful to take biotin. Hugs!
Posts.Title: just diagnosed, overwhelmed and worried katehudson25 katehudson25

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2011 01:16AM katehudson25 wrote: Hi to all those who have been supporting me, I had my re-excision surgery and snb today. Of course I won't know most results till I get my path report Wed. Or Thurs., but I do have some good news. My doctor did a preliminary check for lymph node involvement and the nodes were negative THANK GOD. I won't know if my margins are clear or if I will need plastic surgery until I see my doctor. My breast is bandaged and I am wearing a surgical support bra the hospital gave me and I can't take it off till I see my doctor. For right now I am taking one thing at a time, and I am so very very happy that there does not seem to be lymph node involvement.
